content: Has anyone worked out a standard for finding a patient by NHI? @David Hay ?

Current proposal (for R3) is something like this...
http://fhir3.healthintersections.com.au/open/Patient?identifier=http://nhi.health.nz/|GHI2424
Obviously, this is just a crude example, and any calls on live data would be over https and there is still debate over whether Patient NHIs should be exposed in GET requests. It's a surrogate identifier, but potentially opens a few doors!
Could use the POST equivalent of this query which uses the application/x-www-form-urlencoded content as noted at the bottom of http://build.fhir.org/http.html#summary
Note that we do need to confirm the system...
Oh, and do appreciate that this is just the proposed format of the query - it would still need the MOH to implement it!
...or a vendor. As well as a possible call to a FHIR-based version of the NHI Web Services, that could equally be a call to any system holding details for a particular patient.

really, all that's required is to confirm the system. @Nate Walker - what' the urgency on this? @Peter Jordan what say we have a concrete proposal for the HISO meeting & see if we can get them to confirm at the next meeting? - we could do both NHI & HPI...

@David Hay sounds like a plan. We might ask the HL7NZ Board to vote on this approach at our April or May Board meetings - assuming that we don't receive any significant push-back from the Sector. Are there any objectors out there...?
Assuming that Identifier type is the only one issued by nhi.health.nz (no provider or organization identifiers from there?)
No, the proposed Provider, Facility and Organisation naming system identifiers are hpi-cpn.health.nz, hpi-fac.health.nz and hpi-org.health.nz, respectively.
My hope is to be able to query Orion FHIR patients based on the NHI, within the next couple of months
